verbose_text: The Tor group reported for the first time that neomycin B effectively hydrolyses the phosphodiester group of RNA dinucleoside, as compared to 1,3-diaminopropane and 3-aminopropan-1-ol at pH 8.0 and reverse phase HPLC confirmed the release of adenosine from loss of adenylyl (3 A-5 A) adenosine (ApA) as shown in Figure XREF_FIG.50 It has been demonstrated that the DNA-polyamine conjugate, a sequence specific RNA cleaver was able to break the RNA strand most effectively.
evidence: loss of adenylyl (3 A-5 A) adenosine
